xml.body:
@r201@
Rythe worschypffull master: salutatyons gevyn: these be to
declare unto yow: thatt certen honest men off the parysche
off sayntt aelphegys in Canterbury whoys namys are thes:
John hugden: Raffe Albrythe: Robert absolon; John Barton:
Doo wytness that Thomas Batters the kynges servantt. Also William
Salter the kynges bedd man dwellyng within the city off
Canterbury: In the parysche off sayntt aelpheges on sayntt
Georges day last past : dyd procure certen off ther noygbers
to sett ther handes : other to be contentyd: to have ther namys
sett unto a lettre whom they hadd dyvysyd In testymonyall
ffor the honesty of ther parson: parson off sayntt aelpheges : by
thatt maenes Intendyng to debare: suche honest witnesse as
att thatt tyme aperyd att lambhythe be ffore my lord off Canterbury
wytnessyng suche wordes : as they hard: ther parson speke a yenst
the auctorite off auryculer confession: And thes ii be ffore
namyd Batters a,d Salers: dyd not onely procure off ther
owne parysche : butt off other parysches also suche as they knew
wold bend unto them: Be syde thys: hytt ys here reportyd
by honest men: thatt batters: thatt same day: sayde unto John
hugden with hige crake: thatt the parson off saynt aelpheges : was
troblyd : onley by the maenes off gardner and Schether: butt
he dowtyd nott butt thatt gardner and also Schether schuld
qwayle: Worschypffull master: thes and suche lyke wordes
may geve grett cause to bold men: In ther evyll doynges: unlesse
that yowr masterschyppe ffynd remedy to cause thes bold spekers
to temper ther tongues : God preserve yow: Canterbury
William Gardner prieste
